solidity ^0.8.30;\n\nimport { Ownable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol\";\nimport { ReentrancyGuard } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol\";\nimport { SafeERC20 } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport { IERC20 } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol\";\n\nimport { IComposableCoW, IValueFactory } from \"../interfaces/cow/IComposableCoW.sol\";\nimport { IConditionalOrder } from \"../interfaces/cow/IConditionalOrder.sol\";\nimport { IERC1271, ERC1271_MAGIC_VALUE } from \"../interfaces/cow/IERC1271.sol\";\nimport { GPv2Order } from \"../interfaces/cow/GPv2Order.sol\";\nimport { IGPv2Settlement } from \"../interfaces/cow/IGPv2Settlement.sol\";\nimport { ProtocolTypes } from \"../interfaces/ProtocolTypes.sol\";\n\n// Forward declaration for KapanRouter interface\ninterface IKapanRouter {\n    function processProtocolInstructions(ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[] calldata instructions) external;\n    function isAuthorizedFor(address user) external view returns (bool);\n}\n\n// Forward declaration for KapanCowAdapter interface\ninterface IKapanCowAdapter {\n    function onPreHook(bytes32 orderHash) external;\n    function onPostHook(bytes32 orderHash) external;\n}\n\n/// @title KapanOrderManager\n/// @notice Manages CoW Protocol orders for Kapan, acting as ERC-1271 signer\n/// @dev Singleton contract that holds order context and executes hooks\ncontract KapanOrderManager is Ownable, ReentrancyGuard, IERC1271 {\n    using SafeERC20 for IERC20;\n\n    // ============ Errors ============\n    error OrderNotFound();\n    error OrderAlreadyExists();\n    error InvalidHandler();\n    error NotHooksTrampoline();\n    error HookExecutionFailed();\n    error Unauthorized();\n    error InvalidOrderState();\n    error ZeroAddress();\n    error InstructionUserMismatch(address expected, address actual);\n    error PreHookAlreadyExecuted();\n    error PreHookNotExecuted();\n    error CannotCancelMidExecution();\n\n    // ============ Enums ============\n    enum CompletionType {\n        TargetLTV,          // Complete when target LTV is reached\n        TargetBalance,      // Complete when target balance is reached\n        Iterations,         // Complete after N iterations\n        UntilCancelled      // Run until manually cancelled\n    }\n\n    enum OrderStatus {\n        None,\n        Active,\n        Completed,\n        Cancelled\n    }\n\n    // Router instruction types (must match KapanRouter)\n    enum RouterInstructionType {\n        FlashLoan,\n        PullToken,\n        PushToken,\n        ToOutput,\n        Approve,\n        Split,\n        Add,\n        Subtract\n    }\n\n    // Router instruction struct (must match KapanRouter)\n    struct RouterInstruction {\n        uint256 amount;\n        address token;\n        address user;\n        RouterInstructionType instructionType;\n    }\n\n    // ============ Structs ============\n    \n    /// @notice Order parameters stored for each order\n    struct KapanOrderParams {\n        address user;\n        \n        // Pre-swap instructions (executed in pre-hook) - per iteration\n        // Array of ABI-encoded ProtocolInstruction[] for each iteration\n        // If fewer entries than iterations, last entry is reused\n        bytes[] preInstructionsPerIteration;\n        uint256 preTotalAmount;         // Total amount to process across all chunks\n        \n        // Swap configuration\n        address sellToken;\n        address buyToken;\n        uint256 chunkSize;              // Max sell amount per chunk\n        uint256 minBuyPerChunk;         // Minimum buy amount per chunk (slippage protection)\n        \n        // Post-swap instructions (executed in post-hook) - per iteration\n        // Array of ABI-encoded ProtocolInstruction[] for each iteration\n        // If fewer entries than iterations, last entry is reused\n        // Typically: [0..N-2] = deposit+borrow+push, [N-1] = deposit only\n        bytes[] postInstructionsPerIteration;\n        \n        // Completion\n        CompletionType completion;\n        uint256 targetValue;            // Interpretation depends on CompletionType\n        uint256 minHealthFactor;        // Safety: minimum health factor to maintain\n        \n        // AppData (pre-computed by frontend, includes hooks)\n        bytes32 appDataHash;\n        \n        // Flash loan mode: indicates order uses CoW flash loan for funding\n        // NOTE: receiver is ALWAYS OrderManager regardless of this flag\n        bool isFlashLoanOrder;\n        \n        // Order kind: if true, creates KIND_BUY order instead of KIND_SELL\n        // KIND_SELL: chunkSize = exact sell, minBuyPerChunk = minimum buy (slippage protection)\n        // KIND_BUY: chunkSize = max sell (slippage protection), minBuyPerChunk = exact buy amount\n        bool isKindBuy;\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Order context stored on-chain\n    struct OrderContext {\n        KapanOrderParams params;\n        OrderStatus status;\n        uint256 executedAmount;         // Amount processed so far\n        uint256 iterationCount;         // Number of completed iterations\n        uint256 createdAt;\n    }\n\n    // ============ State Variables ============\n    \n    /// @notice The KapanRouter for executing lending operations\n    IKapanRouter public router;\n    \n    /// @notice The ComposableCoW contract for order registration\n    IComposableCoW public composableCoW;\n    \n    /// @notice The GPv2Settlement contract\n    IGPv2Settlement public settlement;\n    \n    /// @notice The HooksTrampoline contract (caller for hooks)\n    address public hooksTrampoline;\n    \n    /// @notice The KapanOrderHandler for generating orders\n    address public orderHandler;\n\n    /// @notice The KapanCowAdapter for flash loan order security\n    IKapanCowAdapter public cowAdapter;\n\n    /// @notice Order contexts by order hash\n    mapping(bytes32 => OrderContext) public orders;\n    \n    /// @notice Salt used for each order (for ComposableCoW cancellation)\n    mapping(bytes32 => bytes32) public orderSalts;\n    \n    /// @notice User's active orders\n    mapping(address => bytes32[]) public userOrders;\n    \n    /// @notice Lookup order hash by (user, salt) - enables pre-computing appData\n    mapping(address => mapping(bytes32 => bytes32)) public userSaltToOrderHash;\n    \n    /// @notice Track pre-hook execution per order to prevent re-execution\n    /// @dev Stores (iterationCount + 1) when pre-hook executed, 0 means no pre-hook pending\n    mapping(bytes32 => uint256) public preHookExecutedForIteration;\n\n    /// @notice Track seed tokens deposited per order for accurate refunds on cancel\n    mapping(bytes32 => uint256) public orderSeedBalance;\n\n    /// @notice Track token balances at end of pre-hook for delta calculation in post-hook\n    /// @dev Prevents leftover token accumulation from affecting subsequent orders\n    mapping(bytes32 => uint256) public preHookSellBalance;\n    mapping(bytes32 => uint256) public preHookBuyBalance;\n\n    // ============ Events ============\n    \n    event OrderCreated(\n        bytes32 indexed orderHash,\n        address indexed user,\n        address sellToken,\n        address buyToken,\n        uint256 totalAmount,\n        uint256 chunkSize\n    );\n    \n    event OrderCancelled(bytes32 indexed orderHash, address indexed user);\n    event OrderCompleted(bytes32 indexed orderHash, address indexed user, uint256 totalExecuted);\n    event ChunkExecuted(bytes32 indexed orderHash, uint256 chunkIndex, uint256 sellAmount, uint256 buyAmount);\n    event PreHookExecuted(bytes32 indexed orderHash, uint256 chunkIndex);\n    event PostHookExecuted(bytes32 indexed orderHash, uint256 chunkIndex, uint256 receivedAmount);\n    \n    // Admin events\n    event RouterUpdated(address indexed oldRouter, address indexed newRouter);\n    event ComposableCoWUpdated(address indexed oldComposableCoW, address indexed newComposableCoW);\n    event HooksTrampolineUpdated(address indexed oldTrampoline, address indexed newTrampoline);\n    event OrderHandlerUpdated(address indexed oldHandler, address indexed newHandler);\n    event CowAdapterUpdated(address indexed oldAdapter, address indexed newAdapter);\n\n    // ============ Constructor ============\n    \n    constructor(\n        address _owner,\n        address _router,\n        address _composableCoW,\n        address _settlement,\n        address _hooksTrampoline\n    ) Ownable(_owner) {\n        if (_router == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        if (_composableCoW == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        if (_settlement == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        if (_hooksTrampoline == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        \n        router = IKapanRouter(_router);\n        composableCoW = IComposableCoW(_composableCoW);\n        settlement = IGPv2Settlement(_settlement);\n        hooksTrampoline = _hooksTrampoline;\n    }\n\n    // ============ Admin Functions ============\n    \n    function setRouter(address _router) external onlyOwner {\n        if (_router == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        address oldRouter = address(router);\n        router = IKapanRouter(_router);\n        emit RouterUpdated(oldRouter, _router);\n    }\n    \n    function setComposableCoW(address _composableCoW) external onlyOwner {\n        if (_composableCoW == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        address oldComposableCoW = address(composableCoW);\n        composableCoW = IComposableCoW(_composableCoW);\n        emit ComposableCoWUpdated(oldComposableCoW, _composableCoW);\n    }\n    \n    function setHooksTrampoline(address _hooksTrampoline) external onlyOwner {\n        if (_hooksTrampoline == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        address oldTrampoline = hooksTrampoline;\n        hooksTrampoline = _hooksTrampoline;\n        emit HooksTrampolineUpdated(oldTrampoline, _hooksTrampoline);\n    }\n    \n    function setOrderHandler(address _handler) external onlyOwner {\n        if (_handler == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        address oldHandler = orderHandler;\n        orderHandler = _handler;\n        emit OrderHandlerUpdated(oldHandler, _handler);\n    }\n\n    function setCowAdapter(address _cowAdapter) external onlyOwner {\n        address oldAdapter = address(cowAdapter);\n        cowAdapter = IKapanCowAdapter(_cowAdapter);\n        emit CowAdapterUpdated(oldAdapter, _cowAdapter);\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Approve vault relayer to spend a token\n    function approveVaultRelayer(address token) external onlyOwner {\n        if (token == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        address vaultRelayer = settlement.vaultRelayer();\n        IERC20(token).forceApprove(vaultRelayer, type(uint256).max);\n    }\n\n    // ============ Order Creation ============\n    \n    /// @notice Create a new CoW order with seed tokens for first chunk\n    /// @dev User must approve this contract to pull seedAmount of sellToken before calling\n    /// @param params The order parameters\n    /// @param salt Unique salt for the order\n    /// @param seedAmount Amount of sell tokens to pull from user for first chunk (0 to skip)\n    /// @return orderHash The hash identifying this order\n    function createOrder(\n        KapanOrderParams calldata params,\n        bytes32 salt,\n        uint256 seedAmount\n    ) external nonReentrant returns (bytes32 orderHash) {\n        // Validate caller is the order user\n        if (params.user != msg.sender) revert Unauthorized();\n        if (orderHandler == address(0)) revert InvalidHandler();\n\n        // Validate all instructions target the calling user (prevents attacking other users' positions)\n        // Pass address(this) as second arg to allow PullToken from OrderManager (for KIND_BUY post-hooks)\n        _validateInstructionUsers(params.preInstructionsPerIteration, msg.sender, address(this));\n        _validateInstructionUsers(params.postInstructionsPerIteration, msg.sender, address(this));\n        \n        // Compute order hash\n        orderHash = keccak256(abi.encode(params, salt, block.timestamp));\n        \n        // Check order doesn't exist\n        if (orders[orderHash].status != OrderStatus.None) revert OrderAlreadyExists();\n        \n        // Pull seed tokens from user if provided\n        // This ensures OrderManager has balance for CoW API's balance check\n        if (seedAmount > 0) {\n            IERC20(params.sellToken).safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), seedAmount);\n            orderSeedBalance[orderHash] = seedAmount;\n        }\n        \n        // Store order context\n        orders[orderHash] = OrderContext({\n            params: params,\n            status: OrderStatus.Active,\n            executedAmount: 0,\n            iterationCount: 0,\n            createdAt: block.timestamp\n        });\n        \n        // Store salt separately for cancellation\n        orderSalts[orderHash] = salt;\n        \n        // Track user's orders\n        userOrders[params.user].push(orderHash);\n        \n        // Enable lookup by (user, salt) for hook resolution\n        userSaltToOrderHash[params.user][salt] = orderHash;\n        \n        // Register with ComposableCoW\n        IConditionalOrder.ConditionalOrderParams memory cowParams = IConditionalOrder.ConditionalOrderParams({\n            handler: IConditionalOrder(orderHandler),\n            salt: salt,\n            staticData: abi.encode(orderHash)  // Handler looks up context by hash\n        });\n        \n        composableCoW.create(cowParams, true);  // dispatch=true for WatchTower\n        \n        // Ensure vault relayer can spend sellToken\n        _ensureVaultRelayerApproval(params.sellToken);\n        \n        emit OrderCreated(\n            orderHash,\n            params.user,\n            params.sellToken,\n            params.buyToken,\n            params.preTotalAmount,\n            params.chunkSize\n        );\n    }\n\n    // ============ Order Cancellation ============\n    \n    /// @notice Cancel an active order and refund any remaining seed tokens\n    /// @param orderHash The order to cancel\n    function cancelOrder(bytes32 orderHash) external nonReentrant {\n        OrderContext storage ctx = orders[orderHash];\n        \n        if (ctx.status == OrderStatus.None) revert OrderNotFound();\n        if (ctx.params.user != msg.sender) revert Unauthorized();\n        if (ctx.status != OrderStatus.Active) revert InvalidOrderState();\n        \n        // Cannot cancel if pre-hook has executed but post-hook hasn't (mid-execution)\n        if (preHookExecutedForIteration[orderHash] != 0) revert CannotCancelMidExecution();\n        \n        ctx.status = OrderStatus.Cancelled;\n        \n        // Remove from ComposableCoW\n        // Note: We need to compute the same hash ComposableCoW uses\n        bytes32 cowOrderHash = composableCoW.hash(\n            IConditionalOrder.ConditionalOrderParams({\n                handler: IConditionalOrder(orderHandler),\n                salt: orderSalts[orderHash],\n                staticData: abi.encode(orderHash)\n            })\n        );\n        composableCoW.remove(cowOrderHash);\n        \n        // Only refund the tracked seed balance for THIS order\n        // This prevents stealing tokens belonging to other orders\n        uint256 seedToRefund = orderSeedBalance[orderHash];\n        if (seedToRefund > 0) {\n            orderSeedBalance[orderHash] = 0;\n            IERC20(ctx.params.sellToken).safeTransfer(ctx.params.user, seedToRefund);\n        }\n        \n        // Note: We don't refund buyTokens here because:\n        // - If not mid-execution, no buyTokens should be present for this order\n        // - If iterations completed (iterationCount > 0), buyTokens were processed through router\n        // - Any stuck buyTokens can be recovered via owner's recoverTokens()\n        \n        emit OrderCancelled(orderHash, msg.sender);\n    }\n\n    // ============ Hook Execution ============\n    \n    /// @notice Execute pre-hook (called by HooksTrampoline during CoW settlement)\n    /// @dev Prepends a ToOutput instruction with chunkSize, so all stored instructions\n    ///      can reference index 0 for the chunk amount. Chunk index is read from iterationCount.\n    /// @param orderHash The order being settled\n    function executePreHook(bytes32 orderHash) external nonReentrant {\n        _executePreHook(orderHash);\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Execute post-hook (called by HooksTrampoline during CoW settlement)\n    /// @dev Prepends a ToOutput instruction with the actual received amount, so all\n    ///      stored instructions can reference index 0 for the swap output\n    /// @param orderHash The order being settled\n    function executePostHook(bytes32 orderHash) external nonReentrant {\n        _executePostHook(orderHash);\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Execute pre-hook using (user, salt) lookup\n    /// @dev Allows pre-computing appData before order creation. Chunk index is determined\n    ///      from the order's iterationCount, so the same appData works for all chunks.\n    /// @param user The order owner\n    /// @param salt The order salt (known before tx)\n    function executePreHookBySalt(address user, bytes32 salt) external nonReentrant {\n        bytes32 orderHash = userSaltToOrderHash[user][salt];\n        if (orderHash == bytes32(0)) revert OrderNotFound();\n        _executePreHook(orderHash);\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Execute post-hook using (user, salt) lookup\n    /// @dev Allows pre-computing appData before order creation\n    /// @param user The order owner\n    /// @param salt The order salt (known before tx)\n    function executePostHookBySalt(address user, bytes32 salt) external nonReentrant {\n        bytes32 orderHash = userSaltToOrderHash[user][salt];\n        if (orderHash == bytes32(0)) revert OrderNotFound();\n        _executePostHook(orderHash);\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Internal pre-hook execution\n    /// @dev Chunk index is read from ctx.iterationCount so the same appData works for all chunks\n    function _executePreHook(bytes32 orderHash) internal {\n        // Only HooksTrampoline can call this\n        if (msg.sender != hooksTrampoline) revert NotHooksTrampoline();\n\n        OrderContext storage ctx = orders[orderHash];\n        if (ctx.status != OrderStatus.Active) revert InvalidOrderState();\n\n        // SECURITY: For flash loan orders, validate with CowAdapter\n        // This prevents hook hijacking - attacker can't trigger victim's hooks\n        // because fundOrder must have been called with this orderHash first\n        if (ctx.params.isFlashLoanOrder && address(cowAdapter) != address(0)) {\n            cowAdapter.onPreHook(orderHash);\n        }\n\n        // Guard: Pre-hook can only run once per iteration\n        // Value of 0 means no pre-hook pending, non-zero means pre-hook already executed\n        if (preHookExecutedForIteration[orderHash] != 0) revert PreHookAlreadyExecuted();\n\n        // Mark pre-hook as executed for current iteration\n        // Store (iterationCount + 1) so that 0 remains the \"not executed\" sentinel\n        preHookExecutedForIteration[orderHash] = ctx.iterationCount + 1;\n        \n        // Get pre-instructions for current iteration\n        // If fewer entries than iterations, reuse the last entry\n        bytes memory preInstructionsData = _getInstructionsForIteration(\n            ctx.params.preInstructionsPerIteration,\n            ctx.iterationCount\n        );\n        \n        // Decode stored pre-instructions\n        ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[] memory storedInstructions = \n            abi.decode(preInstructionsData, (ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[]));\n        \n        // Create new array with ToOutput prepended\n        ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[] memory instructions = \n            new ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[](storedInstructions.length + 1);\n        \n        // Prepend ToOutput with chunkSize - this becomes index 0\n        instructions[0] = ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction({\n            protocolName: \"router\",\n            data: _encodeToOutput(ctx.params.chunkSize, ctx.params.sellToken)\n        });\n        \n        // Copy stored instructions (their indices shift by 1, but they reference index 0)\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < storedInstructions.length; i++) {\n            instructions[i + 1] = storedInstructions[i];\n        }\n        \n        // Execute via router (router will check delegation)\n        router.processProtocolInstructions(instructions);\n\n        // Record balances at end of pre-hook for delta calculation in post-hook\n        // This prevents leftover tokens from previous orders affecting this order\n        preHookSellBalance[orderHash] = IERC20(ctx.params.sellToken).balanceOf(address(this));\n        preHookBuyBalance[orderHash] = IERC20(ctx.params.buyToken).balanceOf(address(this));\n\n        // Emit with current iteration count (chunk index is self-determined from state)\n        emit PreHookExecuted(orderHash, ctx.iterationCount);\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Internal post-hook execution\n    /// @dev For KIND_SELL: Prepends 1 UTXO (received buyToken amount)\n    ///      For KIND_BUY: Prepends 2 UTXOs (actual sell amount, leftover sell amount)\n    function _executePostHook(bytes32 orderHash) internal {\n        // Only HooksTrampoline can call this\n        if (msg.sender != hooksTrampoline) revert NotHooksTrampoline();\n        \n        OrderContext storage ctx = orders[orderHash];\n        if (ctx.status != OrderStatus.Active) revert InvalidOrderState();\n        \n        // Guard: Post-hook requires pre-hook to have executed for this iteration\n        // preHookExecutedForIteration stores (iterationCount + 1) when pre-hook ran\n        if (preHookExecutedForIteration[orderHash] != ctx.iterationCount + 1) revert PreHookNotExecuted();\n        \n        // Reset the pre-hook flag (allows next iteration's pre-hook to run)\n        preHookExecutedForIteration[orderHash] = 0;\n        \n        // Get post-instructions for current iteration\n        bytes memory postInstructionsData = _getInstructionsForIteration(\n            ctx.params.postInstructionsPerIteration,\n            ctx.iterationCount\n        );\n        \n        // Decode stored post-instructions\n        ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[] memory storedInstructions = \n            abi.decode(postInstructionsData, (ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[]));\n        \n        // Calculate deltas using pre-hook recorded balances\n        // This prevents leftover tokens from previous orders affecting this order\n        uint256 sellBefore = preHookSellBalance[orderHash];\n        uint256 buyBefore = preHookBuyBalance[orderHash];\n        uint256 sellAfter = IERC20(ctx.params.sellToken).balanceOf(address(this));\n        uint256 buyAfter = IERC20(ctx.params.buyToken).balanceOf(address(this));\n\n        // Clear stored balances (no longer needed, saves gas on subsequent reads)\n        delete preHookSellBalance[orderHash];\n        delete preHookBuyBalance[orderHash];\n\n        // Calculate actual amounts using deltas\n        uint256 actualSellAmount = sellBefore > sellAfter ? sellBefore - sellAfter : 0;\n        uint256 actualBuyAmount = buyAfter > buyBefore ? buyAfter - buyBefore : 0;\n\n        ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[] memory instructions;\n\n        if (ctx.params.isKindBuy) {\n            // KIND_BUY: actualSellAmount is the delta, actualBuyAmount should match minBuyPerChunk\n            // Calculate remaining from intended chunkSize, not from balance (avoids leftover issues)\n            uint256 remainingSellToken = actualSellAmount < ctx.params.chunkSize\n                ? ctx.params.chunkSize - actualSellAmount\n                : 0;\n\n            // Transfer only the calculated remaining to router (not any pre-existing leftovers)\n            if (remainingSellToken > 0 && sellAfter >= remainingSellToken) {\n                IERC20(ctx.params.sellToken).safeTransfer(address(router), remainingSellToken);\n            }\n\n            // Approve router to pull buyToken (for PullToken instruction in post-hook)\n            // Only approve the delta amount, not any pre-existing balance\n            if (actualBuyAmount > 0) {\n                IERC20(ctx.params.buyToken).forceApprove(address(router), actualBuyAmount);\n            }\n\n            // Prepend TWO UTXOs for KIND_BUY:\n            // UTXO[0] = actual sell amount (what we paid)\n            // UTXO[1] = leftover amount (what wasn't used, now at router)\n            instructions = new ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[](storedInstructions.length + 2);\n            instructions[0] = ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction({\n                protocolName: \"router\",\n                data: _encodeToOutput(actualSellAmount, ctx.params.sellToken)\n            });\n            instructions[1] = ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction({\n                protocolName: \"router\",\n                data: _encodeToOutput(remainingSellToken, ctx.params.sellToken)\n            });\n\n            // Copy stored instructions (indices shift by 2)\n            for (uint256 i = 0; i < storedInstructions.length; i++) {\n                instructions[i + 2] = storedInstructions[i];\n            }\n        } else {\n            // KIND_SELL: actualBuyAmount is the delta (what we received from swap)\n            // Transfer only the delta to router (not any pre-existing leftovers)\n            if (actualBuyAmount > 0) {\n                IERC20(ctx.params.buyToken).safeTransfer(address(router), actualBuyAmount);\n            }\n\n            // Prepend ONE UTXO for KIND_SELL:\n            // UTXO[0] = received amount (delta - what we got from swap)\n            instructions = new ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[](storedInstructions.length + 1);\n            instructions[0] = ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction({\n                protocolName: \"router\",\n                data: _encodeToOutput(actualBuyAmount, ctx.params.buyToken)\n            });\n\n            // Copy stored instructions (indices shift by 1)\n            for (uint256 i = 0; i < storedInstructions.length; i++) {\n                instructions[i + 1] = storedInstructions[i];\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Execute via router\n        router.processProtocolInstructions(instructions);\n        \n        // Update progress with actual amounts\n        ctx.executedAmount += actualSellAmount;\n        ctx.iterationCount++;\n        \n        // Clear seed balance after first iteration (seed was consumed by the swap)\n        // This ensures cancel won't try to refund already-used tokens\n        if (orderSeedBalance[orderHash] > 0) {\n            orderSeedBalance[orderHash] = 0;\n        }\n        \n        // Emit chunk execution event with actual sell/buy amounts for frontend tracking\n        emit ChunkExecuted(orderHash, ctx.iterationCount, actualSellAmount, actualBuyAmount);\n        \n        // Check completion\n        if (_isOrderComplete(ctx)) {\n            ctx.status = OrderStatus.Completed;\n            emit OrderCompleted(orderHash, ctx.params.user, ctx.executedAmount);\n        }\n\n        emit PostHookExecuted(orderHash, ctx.iterationCount, actualBuyAmount);\n\n        // SECURITY: For flash loan orders, finalize with CowAdapter\n        // This clears the adapter state, ensuring proper cleanup\n        if (ctx.params.isFlashLoanOrder && address(cowAdapter) != address(0)) {\n            cowAdapter.onPostHook(orderHash);\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ============ ERC-1271 Signature Verification ============\n    \n    /// @notice Verify signature for CoW Protocol orders\n    /// @dev For non-Safe ERC-1271 contracts, ComposableCoW returns signature as:\n    ///      abi.encode(GPv2Order.Data, PayloadStruct)\n    ///      We decode this and verify the order matches what the handler generates.\n    function isValidSignature(\n        bytes32 _hash,\n        bytes calldata _signature\n    ) external view override returns (bytes4) {\n        // For ERC-1271 forwarder pattern (non-Safe), signature = abi.encode(order, payload)\n        // We need to decode both parts\n        (GPv2Order.Data memory order, IComposableCoW.PayloadStruct memory payload) =\n            abi.decode(_signature, (GPv2Order.Data, IComposableCoW.PayloadStruct));\n\n        // Verify the hash matches the computed order hash\n        bytes32 computedHash = GPv2Order.hash(order, settlement.domainSeparator());\n        if (_hash != computedHash) {\n            return bytes4(0xffffffff);\n        }\n\n        // Verify via ComposableCoW - this checks authorization and generates the expected order\n        // ComposableCoW will call the handler's verify() function\n        try composableCoW.getTradeableOrderWithSignature(\n            address(this),\n            payload.params,\n            payload.offchainInput,\n            payload.proof\n        ) returns (GPv2Order.Data memory expectedOrder, bytes memory) {\n            // Verify the provided order matches the expected order\n            // The hash should match what we expect for this order\n            if (_orderMatches(order, expectedOrder)) {\n                return ERC1271_MAGIC_VALUE;\n            }\n            return bytes4(0xffffffff);\n        } catch {\n            return bytes4(0xffffffff);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /// @dev Check if two GPv2Orders match (excluding validTo which changes)\n    function _orderMatches(GPv2Order.Data memory a, GPv2Order.Data memory b) internal pure returns (bool) {\n        return address(a.sellToken) == address(b.sellToken) &&\n               address(a.buyToken) == address(b.buyToken) &&\n               a.receiver == b.receiver &&\n               a.sellAmount == b.sellAmount &&\n               a.buyAmount == b.buyAmount &&\n               a.appData == b.appData &&\n               a.feeAmount == b.feeAmount &&\n               a.kind == b.kind &&\n               a.partiallyFillable == b.partiallyFillable &&\n               a.sellTokenBalance == b.sellTokenBalance &&\n               a.buyTokenBalance == b.buyTokenBalance;\n    }\n\n    // ============ View Functions ============\n    \n    /// @notice Get order context\n    function getOrder(bytes32 orderHash) external view returns (OrderContext memory) {\n        return orders[orderHash];\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Get user's orders\n    function getUserOrders(address user) external view returns (bytes32[] memory) {\n        return userOrders[user];\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Check if an order is complete based on completion criteria\n    function isOrderComplete(bytes32 orderHash) external view returns (bool) {\n        return _isOrderComplete(orders[orderHash]);\n    }\n\n    // ============ Internal Functions ============\n    \n    function _isOrderComplete(OrderContext storage ctx) internal view returns (bool) {\n        if (ctx.params.completion == CompletionType.Iterations) {\n            return ctx.iterationCount >= ctx.params.targetValue;\n        }\n        \n        if (ctx.params.completion == CompletionType.TargetBalance) {\n            // Check remaining amount\n            uint256 remaining = ctx.params.preTotalAmount - ctx.executedAmount;\n            return remaining == 0 || remaining < ctx.params.chunkSize;\n        }\n        \n        if (ctx.params.completion == CompletionType.TargetLTV) {\n            // TODO: Read actual LTV from lending protocol\n            // For now, check if we've executed the total amount\n            return ctx.executedAmount >= ctx.params.preTotalAmount;\n        }\n        \n        // UntilCancelled never completes automatically\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    // ============ Instruction Validation ============\n    \n    /// @dev Constant hash for \"router\" protocol name comparison\n    bytes32 private constant ROUTER_PROTOCOL_HASH = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(\"router\"));\n    \n    /// @notice Validate that all instructions in all iterations target the expected user\n    /// @dev Prevents attackers from encoding instructions that operate on other users' positions\n    ///      Note: Only certain instruction types require strict validation (PullToken, lending ops)\n    /// @param instructionsPerIteration Array of encoded ProtocolInstruction[] per iteration\n    /// @param expectedUser The user who must be the target of security-sensitive instructions\n    function _validateInstructionUsers(\n        bytes[] calldata instructionsPerIteration,\n        address expectedUser,\n        address selfAddress\n    ) internal pure {\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < instructionsPerIteration.length; i++) {\n            ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[] memory instructions =\n                abi.decode(instructionsPerIteration[i], (ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[]));\n\n            for (uint256 j = 0; j < instructions.length; j++) {\n                address instrUser = _extractUserFromInstruction(instructions[j], expectedUser, selfAddress);\n                if (instrUser != expectedUser) {\n                    revert InstructionUserMismatch(expectedUser, instrUser);\n                }\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Extract the user address from a protocol instruction that requires validation\n    /// @dev Returns expectedUser for instructions that don't need user validation (PushToken, ToOutput, etc.)\n    ///      Only PullToken and lending instructions need strict user validation\n    /// @param instruction The protocol instruction to extract user from\n    /// @param expectedUser The expected user (returned for instructions that don't need validation)\n    /// @param selfAddress The OrderManager's address (allowed as source for PullToken in KIND_BUY post-hooks)\n    /// @return user The user address to validate (or expectedUser if no validation needed)\n    function _extractUserFromInstruction(\n        ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction memory instruction,\n        address expectedUser,\n        address selfAddress\n    ) internal pure returns (address user) {\n        bytes32 protocolHash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(instruction.protocolName));\n\n        if (protocolHash == ROUTER_PROTOCOL_HASH) {\n            // Decode RouterInstruction (same method as KapanRouter)\n            RouterInstruction memory routerInstruction = abi.decode(instruction.data, (RouterInstruction));\n\n            // Only PullToken needs strict user validation (prevents stealing from other users)\n            // Other instruction types have different semantics for the user field:\n            // - PushToken: user = recipient (can be OrderManager, adapters, etc.)\n            // - ToOutput: user = unused (always address(0))\n            // - Approve: user = unused (always address(0))\n            // - FlashLoan: user = unused (always address(0))\n            // - Add/Subtract/Split: user = unused (always address(0))\n            if (routerInstruction.instructionType == RouterInstructionType.PullToken) {\n                // Allow PullToken from self (OrderManager) for KIND_BUY post-hooks\n                // where tokens land in OrderManager from CoW settlement\n                if (routerInstruction.user == selfAddress) {\n                    user = expectedUser; // Skip validation for self\n                } else {\n                    user = routerInstruction.user;\n                }\n            } else {\n                // Skip validation for other router instructions\n                user = expectedUser;\n            }\n        } else {\n            // Lending instruction (gateway): struct LendingInstruction { op, token, user, amount, context, input }\n            // All lending operations need strict user validation\n            ProtocolTypes.LendingInstruction memory lending =\n                abi.decode(instruction.data, (ProtocolTypes.LendingInstruction));\n            user = lending.user;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Encode a ToOutput router instruction\n    /// @dev Matches the encoding expected by KapanRouter's RouterInstruction struct\n    ///      struct RouterInstruction { uint256 amount; address token; address user; RouterInstructionType instructionType; }\n    ///      RouterInstructionType.ToOutput = 3\n    function _encodeToOutput(uint256 amount, address token) internal pure returns (bytes memory) {\n        // ABI encode as tuple matching RouterInstruction struct layout\n        // Note: RouterInstructionType enum is uint8, but in ABI encoding it's padded to 32 bytes\n        return abi.encode(amount, token, address(0), uint8(3));\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Get instructions for a specific iteration\n    /// @dev If the array has fewer entries than the iteration index, returns the last entry\n    ///      This allows specifying different instructions for early iterations vs later ones\n    ///      e.g., [depositAndBorrow, depositAndBorrow, depositOnly] for 3 iterations\n    /// @param instructionsArray Array of encoded instructions per iteration\n    /// @param iteration Current iteration index (0-based)\n    /// @return The encoded instructions for this iteration\n    function _getInstructionsForIteration(\n        bytes[] storage instructionsArray,\n        uint256 iteration\n    ) internal view returns (bytes memory) {\n        if (instructionsArray.length == 0) {\n            // Return empty instructions if none provided\n            return abi.encode(new ProtocolTypes.ProtocolInstruction[](0));\n        }\n        \n        // If iteration index exceeds array length, use the last entry\n        uint256 index = iteration < instructionsArray.length \n            ? iteration \n            : instructionsArray.length - 1;\n            \n        return instructionsArray[index];\n    }\n    \n    function _ensureVaultRelayerApproval(address token) internal {\n        address vaultRelayer = settlement.vaultRelayer();\n        uint256 currentAllowance = IERC20(token).allowance(address(this), vaultRelayer);\n        if (currentAllowance < type(uint256).max / 2) {\n            IERC20(token).forceApprove(vaultRelayer, type(uint256).max);\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ============ Emergency Functions ============\n    \n    /// @notice Recover stuck tokens (owner only)\n    function recoverTokens(address token, address to, uint256 amount) external onlyOwner {\n        IERC20(token).safeTransfer(to, amount);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x6401f7f587b4ec2f77077ba24ed0035419c6ae335d1552d3fce79d65c46b2264","license":"MIT"},"contracts/v2/interfaces/ProtocolTypes.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.30;\n\nlibrary ProtocolTypes {\n    struct ProtocolInstruction {\n        string protocolName;\n        bytes data;\n    }\n\n    struct Output {\n        address token;\n        uint256 amount;\n    }\n\n    // Common lending instruction schema for gateways (deposit/withdraw/borrow/repay)\n    enum LendingOp {\n        Deposit,\n        DepositCollateral,\n        WithdrawCollateral,\n        Borrow,\n        Repay,\n        GetBorrowBalance,\n        GetSupplyBalance,\n        Swap,\n        SwapExactOut,\n        SetEMode  // Aave V3 E-Mode: amount encodes categoryId (0 = disable E-Mode)\n    }\n    struct InputPtr {\n        uint256 index;\n    }\n    /**\n     * Cross-protocol instruction.\n     * - For Compound you can pass `context = abi.encode(address marketBaseToken)`\n     *   which tells the gateway which Comet (market) to use. Empty means infer from token.\n     */\n    struct LendingInstruction {\n        LendingOp op;\n        address token; // underlying being acted on (base or collateral)\n        address user; // end user on whose account we operate\n        uint256 amount; // amount in underlying units\n        bytes context; // (optional) protocol-specific blob (e.g., Compound marketBaseToken)\n        InputPtr input; // (optional) pointer to prior output (UTXO); use if index < inputs.length\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x6b3d27ea42baef69a30052ada687149250a56be5942577d654f2f2142a5510c6","license":"MIT"},"contracts/v2/interfaces/cow/GPv2Order.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.30;\n\nimport { IERC20 } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol\";\n\n/// @title GPv2Order - CoW Protocol order library\n/// @notice Data structures and helpers for CoW Protocol orders\nlibrary GPv2Order {\n    /// @dev The complete order data that is signed by the user\n    struct Data {\n        IERC20 sellToken;\n        IERC20 buyToken;\n        address receiver;\n        uint256 sellAmount;\n        uint256 buyAmount;\n        uint32 validTo;\n        bytes32 appData;\n        uint256 feeAmount;\n        bytes32 kind;\n        bool partiallyFillable;\n        bytes32 sellTokenBalance;\n        bytes32 buyTokenBalance;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Order kind constants\n    bytes32 internal constant KIND_SELL =\n        keccak256(\"sell\");\n    bytes32 internal constant KIND_BUY =\n        keccak256(\"buy\");\n\n    /// @dev Token balance constants\n    bytes32 internal constant BALANCE_ERC20 =\n        keccak256(\"erc20\");\n    bytes32 internal constant BALANCE_EXTERNAL =\n        keccak256(\"external\");\n    bytes32 internal constant BALANCE_INTERNAL =\n        keccak256(\"internal\");\n\n    /// @dev The order EIP-712 type hash\n    bytes32 internal constant TYPE_HASH =\n        keccak256(\n            \"Order(\"\n            \"address sellToken,\"\n            \"address buyToken,\"\n            \"address receiver,\"\n            \"uint256 sellAmount,\"\n            \"uint256 buyAmount,\"\n            \"uint32 validTo,\"\n            \"bytes32 appData,\"\n            \"uint256 feeAmount,\"\n            \"string kind,\"\n            \"bool partiallyFillable,\"\n            \"string sellTokenBalance,\"\n            \"string buyTokenBalance\"\n            \")\"\n        );\n\n    /// @dev Computes the order hash for the given order data\n    /// @param order The order to hash\n    /// @param domainSeparator The EIP-712 domain separator\n    /// @return orderDigest The order digest\n    function hash(Data memory order, bytes32 domainSeparator) internal pure returns (bytes32 orderDigest) {\n        bytes32 structHash = keccak256(\n            abi.encode(\n                TYPE_HASH,\n                order.sellToken,\n                order.buyToken,\n                order.receiver,\n                order.sellAmount,\n                order.buyAmount,\n                order.validTo,\n                order.appData,\n                order.feeAmount,\n                order.kind,\n                order.partiallyFillable,\n                order.sellTokenBalance,\n                order.buyTokenBalance\n            )\n        );\n        orderDigest = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(\"\\x19\\x01\", domainSeparator, structHash));\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x9b8e973f4ab364c4dc43f72ee73171a589c5a9cadfb2778281e3c1e6bfc531f9","license":"MIT"},"contracts/v2/interfaces/cow/IComposableCoW.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.30;\n\nimport { IConditionalOrder } from \"./IConditionalOrder.sol\";\nimport { GPv2Order } from \"./GPv2Order.sol\";\n\n/// @title IComposableCoW - Interface for the ComposableCoW contract\n/// @notice Registry for conditional orders on CoW Protocol\ninterface IComposableCoW {\n    /// @dev Proof location for merkle roots\n    struct Proof {\n        uint256 location;\n        bytes data;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Payload passed for signature verification\n    struct PayloadStruct {\n        bytes32[] proof;\n        IConditionalOrder.ConditionalOrderParams params;\n        bytes offchainInput;\n    }\n\n    // ============ Events ============\n\n    /// @notice Emitted when a conditional order is created\n    event ConditionalOrderCreated(\n        address indexed owner,\n        IConditionalOrder.ConditionalOrderParams params\n    );\n\n    /// @notice Emitted when a merkle root is set\n    event MerkleRootSet(\n        address indexed owner,\n        bytes32 root,\n        Proof proof\n    );\n\n    // ============ State Variables ============\n\n    /// @notice Get the merkle root for an owner\n    function roots(address owner) external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    /// @notice Check if a single order exists\n    function singleOrders(address owner, bytes32 singleOrderHash) external view returns (bool);\n\n    /// @notice Get order-specific storage\n    function cabinet(address owner, bytes32 ctx) external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    // ============ User Functions ============\n\n    /// @notice Create a single conditional order\n    /// @param params The conditional order parameters\n    /// @param dispatch If true, emit ConditionalOrderCreated event\n    function create(\n        IConditionalOrder.ConditionalOrderParams calldata params,\n        bool dispatch\n    ) external;\n\n    /// @notice Create a conditional order with context\n    /// @param params The conditional order parameters\n    /// @param factory Factory to generate context value\n    /// @param data Data passed to factory\n    /// @param dispatch If true, emit ConditionalOrderCreated event\n    function createWithContext(\n        IConditionalOrder.ConditionalOrderParams calldata params,\n        IValueFactory factory,\n        bytes calldata data,\n        bool dispatch\n    ) external;\n\n    /// @notice Remove a single conditional order\n    /// @param singleOrderHash Hash of the order to remove: H(ConditionalOrderParams)\n    function remove(bytes32 singleOrderHash) external;\n\n    /// @notice Set the merkle root for conditional orders\n    /// @param root The merkle root\n    /// @param proof Proof data for the root\n    function setRoot(bytes32 root, Proof calldata proof) external;\n\n    /// @notice Set the merkle root with context\n    /// @param root The merkle root\n    /// @param proof Proof data for the root\n    /// @param factory Factory to generate context value\n    /// @param data Data passed to factory\n    function setRootWithContext(\n        bytes32 root,\n        Proof calldata proof,\n        IValueFactory factory,\n        bytes calldata data\n    ) external;\n\n    /// @notice Set cabinet value for an order\n    /// @param ctx The context (order hash)\n    /// @param value The value to store\n    function setCabinet(bytes32 ctx, bytes32 value) external;\n\n    // ============ Watch-tower Functions ============\n\n    /// @notice Get a tradeable order with signature for submission to CoW API\n    /// @param owner The owner of the conditional order\n    /// @param params The conditional order parameters\n    /// @param offchainInput Off-chain provided data\n    /// @param proof Merkle proof (empty for single orders)\n    /// @return order The tradeable GPv2Order\n    /// @return signature The ERC-1271 signature for the order\n    function getTradeableOrderWithSignature(\n        address owner,\n        IConditionalOrder.ConditionalOrderParams calldata params,\n        bytes calldata offchainInput,\n        bytes32[] calldata proof\n    ) external view returns (GPv2Order.Data memory order, bytes memory signature);\n\n    /// @notice Compute the hash of conditional order params\n    /// @param params The conditional order parameters\n    /// @return The keccak256 hash\n    function hash(IConditionalOrder.ConditionalOrderParams memory params) external pure returns (bytes32);\n}\n\n/// @title IValueFactory - Interface for context value factories\ninterface IValueFactory {\n    function getValue(bytes calldata data) external view returns (bytes32);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x5d32361b94dc18b01210fb3924a1896ec3d2152c3ee5dee4170ad2ab9ca73c14","license":"MIT"},"contracts/v2/interfaces/cow/IConditionalOrder.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.30;\n\nimport { GPv2Order } from \"./GPv2Order.sol\";\n\n/// @title IConditionalOrder - Interface for conditional order handlers\n/// @notice Defines the interface for creating conditional/programmatic orders on CoW Protocol\ninterface IConditionalOrder {\n    /// @dev Conditional order parameters stored on-chain\n    struct ConditionalOrderParams {\n        IConditionalOrder handler;\n        bytes32 salt;\n        bytes staticData;\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Verifies that a discrete order is valid for the conditional order\n    /// @param owner The owner of the conditional order\n    /// @param sender The msg.sender calling isValidSignature\n    /// @param _hash The EIP-712 order digest\n    /// @param domainSeparator The EIP-712 domain separator\n    /// @param ctx The execution context (H(params) for single, merkle root for tree)\n    /// @param staticInput Order-specific data known at creation time\n    /// @param offchainInput Order-specific data NOT known at creation time\n    /// @param order The proposed discrete order\n    function verify(\n        address owner,\n        address sender,\n        bytes32 _hash,\n        bytes32 domainSeparator,\n        bytes32 ctx,\n        bytes calldata staticInput,\n        bytes calldata offchainInput,\n        GPv2Order.Data calldata order\n    ) external view;\n}\n\n/// @title IConditionalOrderGenerator - Interface for conditional order generators\n/// @notice Extends IConditionalOrder to generate tradeable orders\ninterface IConditionalOrderGenerator is IConditionalOrder {\n    /// @notice Generates a tradeable GPv2Order based on the current state\n    /// @param owner The owner of the conditional order\n    /// @param sender The msg.sender (usually ComposableCoW)\n    /// @param ctx The execution context\n    /// @param staticInput Order-specific data known at creation time\n    /// @param offchainInput Order-specific data provided by the watch-tower\n    /// @return order The generated GPv2Order.Data struct\n    function getTradeableOrder(\n        address owner,\n        address sender,\n        bytes32 ctx,\n        bytes calldata staticInput,\n        bytes calldata offchainInput\n    ) external view returns (GPv2Order.Data memory order);\n}\n\n/// @title Conditional Order Errors\n/// @notice Custom errors for signaling to watch-towers\n\n/// @dev Signal to try polling again at the next block\nerror PollTryNextBlock(string reason);\n\n/// @dev Signal to try polling at a specific block\nerror PollTryAtBlock(uint256 blockNumber, string reason);\n\n/// @dev Signal to try polling at a specific timestamp\nerror PollTryAtEpoch(uint256 timestamp, string reason);\n\n/// @dev Signal to stop polling this order (completed or cancelled)\nerror PollNever(string reason);\n\n/// @dev Signal that the order parameters are invalid\nerror OrderNotValid(string reason);\n\n/// @dev Signal that the order is not currently tradeable\nerror OrderNotReady(string reason);\n","keccak256":"0x8ed6bb23c9714b66979060191d71c9601b8cc69df40b8d9b06d284e00b318eca","license":"MIT"},"contracts/v2/interfaces/cow/IERC1271.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.30;\n\n/// @title IERC1271 - Standard Signature Validation Method for Contracts\n/// @notice Interface for smart contract signature verification (EIP-1271)\ninterface IERC1271 {\n    /// @notice Verifies that the signature is valid for the given hash\n    /// @param _hash The hash of the data signed\n    /// @param _signature The signature bytes\n    /// @return magicValue bytes4(0x1626ba7e) if valid, any other value if invalid\n    function isValidSignature(\n        bytes32 _hash,\n        bytes calldata _signature\n    ) external view returns (bytes4 magicValue);\n}\n\n/// @dev Magic value returned by isValidSignature when the signature is valid\nbytes4 constant ERC1271_MAGIC_VALUE = 0x1626ba7e;\n","keccak256":"0xfc8d13b64ef33eb48e545921ed5d2cd9aae1ab79a7696d13c35546517cf62afa","license":"MIT"},"contracts/v2/interfaces/cow/IGPv2Settlement.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.30;\n\n/// @title IGPv2Settlement - Interface for CoW Protocol Settlement contract\n/// @notice Minimal interface for interacting with GPv2Settlement\ninterface IGPv2Settlement {\n    /// @notice Returns the domain separator used for signing orders\n    function domainSeparator() external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the address of the vault relayer\n    /// @dev The vault relayer is approved to transfer tokens on behalf of users\n    function vaultRelayer() external view returns (address);\n\n    /// @notice Invalidate an order to prevent it from being filled\n    /// @dev This marks the order as cancelled in Settlement storage and emits an event\n    ///      that CoW indexers/Explorer pick up to show \"cancelled\" status\n    /// @param orderUid The unique order ID: abi.encodePacked(orderDigest, owner, validTo)\n    function invalidateOrder(bytes calldata orderUid) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0xe5dc751c92f434e79a98219519783b2192f480f5d0dc698323bb7e5d24178b89","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: Singleton contract that holds order context and executes hooks

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

AddressInsufficientBalance(address).details: The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.

FailedInnerCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC20 token failed.

createOrder((address,bytes[],uint256,add.details: User must approve this contract to pull seedAmount of sellToken before calling

params.seedAmount: Amount of sell tokens to pull from user for first chunk (0 to skip)

executePostHook(bytes32).details: Prepends a ToOutput instruction with the actual received amount, so all      stored instructions can reference index 0 for the swap output

executePostHookBySalt(address,bytes32).details: Allows pre-computing appData before order creation

executePreHook(bytes32).details: Prepends a ToOutput instruction with chunkSize, so all stored instructions      can reference index 0 for the chunk amount. Chunk index is read from iterationCount.

executePreHookBySalt(address,bytes32).details: Allows pre-computing appData before order creation. Chunk index is determined      from the order's iterationCount, so the same appData works for all chunks.

isValidSignature(bytes32,bytes).details: For non-Safe ERC-1271 contracts, ComposableCoW returns signature as:      abi.encode(GPv2Order.Data, PayloadStruct)      We decode this and verify the order matches what the handler generates.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

ROUTER_PROTOCOL_HASH.details: Constant hash for "router" protocol name comparison

preHookExecutedForIteration.details: Stores (iterationCount + 1) when pre-hook executed, 0 means no pre-hook pending

preHookSellBalance.details: Prevents leftover token accumulation from affecting subsequent orders

approveVaultRelayer(address).notice: Approve vault relayer to spend a token

cancelOrder(bytes32).notice: Cancel an active order and refund any remaining seed tokens

cowAdapter().notice: The KapanCowAdapter for flash loan order security

createOrder((address,bytes[],uint256,add.notice: Create a new CoW order with seed tokens for first chunk

executePostHook(bytes32).notice: Execute post-hook (called by HooksTrampoline during CoW settlement)

executePreHook(bytes32).notice: Execute pre-hook (called by HooksTrampoline during CoW settlement)

isOrderComplete(bytes32).notice: Check if an order is complete based on completion criteria

isValidSignature(bytes32,bytes).notice: Verify signature for CoW Protocol orders

orderSalts(bytes32).notice: Salt used for each order (for ComposableCoW cancellation)

orderSeedBalance(bytes32).notice: Track seed tokens deposited per order for accurate refunds on cancel

preHookExecutedForIteration(bytes32).notice: Track pre-hook execution per order to prevent re-execution

preHookSellBalance(bytes32).notice: Track token balances at end of pre-hook for delta calculation in post-hook

router().notice: The KapanRouter for executing lending operations

userSaltToOrderHash(address,bytes32).notice: Lookup order hash by (user, salt) - enables pre-computing appData
